metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14614 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 4.17.10. There is an out-of-bounds access in __remove_dirty_segment() in fs/f2fs/segment.c when mounting an f2fs image. Wen Xu discovered that the f2fs file system implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly validate metadata. An attacker could use this to construct a malicious f2fs image that, when mounted, could cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14614` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1040-aws - 4.4.0-1040.43
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-144-generic - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-lowlatency - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-144-generic - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-144-lowlatency - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-144-generic - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-lowlatency - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-144-generic - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-144-lowlatency - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> The affected user base for this issue is likely small since f2fs is not the default filesystem and it is not widely used in Ubuntu

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1040.43').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
